triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs form the core computational foundation for the generative agents' decision-making and behavior generation.

triples.name: Reflection (artificial intelligence)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using reflection to synthesize agent memories into higher-level reflections for improved planning.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a planning component that allows agents to dynamically generate behavior based on observations and memories.

triples.name: Intelligent agent
triples.relevance: The paper introduces generative agents as a novel type of intelligent agent that simulates believable human behavior autonomously.

triples.name: The Sims
triples.relevance: The paper uses The Sims as inspiration for creating an interactive sandbox environment where agents populate and interact.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: NLP enables agents to store experiences and interact with users entirely through natural language.

triples.name: Social simulation
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates emergent social behaviors where agents autonomously coordinate social events like parties.

triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a multi-agent system where individual agents interact to create emergent behaviors at the system level.
